body.p:
Calhoon 30th Oct. 1863.
Gen Bramlette
Governor of Kentucky

Sir the undersigned Would Respectfully Represent, that, One F. M Shrader of. Calhoon Ky. On the 28 Oct 1863. Without Cause or. provocation. shot. and killed James Robards of Calhoon Ky. and Who. Was arrested for the Crime and while the Examining Court Was in Session made his Escape from the officers and has fled Said F. M. Shrder is about 6 feet High Light Complection Light Hare Spare Built Wears Mustache & whiskers

the undersigned Would Represent that. Decedants. (Roberts) family one poor. and Unable to offer a Reward for. his apprehension and as the State Should guard and protect the poor. They ask that your Honor Will offer a Reward for. F M Shrader apprehension that he may be tried for the offense he has Committed

Wm. H. Robards
George Mc. Robards

Let them have Pet of County or Circuit judge as required by Chap -- Sect -- Vol --
Stantons Revised Statutes
